item.title: 英国の専門誌出版社ヘイマーケットは、自動車メーカーが広告費を削減したため、自動車部門の従業員120人のうち最大14人を解雇する計画だ（Charlotte Tobitt/Press Gazette）。
item.description:
Charlotte Tobitt / Press Gazette:
UK specialist magazine publisher Haymarket plans to lay off up to 14 of 120 employees in its automotive division after carmakers cut back on their ad spend  —  The teams behind What Car? and Autocar are restructuring to cope with turbulence in the industry.

item.title: NPRの主要番組の司会者で有色人種の女性であるレイラ・ファデル、ミシェル・マーティン、アイーシャ・ラスコー、フアナ・サマーズが、多様化に向けた同局の取り組みについて語る（Jennifer Gerson/The 19th)
item.description:
Jennifer Gerson / The 19th:
Leila Fadel, Michel Martin, Ayesha Rascoe, and Juana Summers, the hosts of flagship NPR programs and women of color, discuss the outlet's efforts to diversify  —  Show your support for news that represents you.  Donate today.  —  Juana Summers is struck by “an incredible sense of responsibility.”

item.title: YouTubeでは、Slateのポッドキャストは先週平均75回/ビデオ、NPRは平均179回/ビデオで、スタジオの映像が再生回数を押し上げている（Ashley Carman/Bloomberg)
item.description:
Ashley Carman / Bloomberg:
Despite big reach elsewhere, on YouTube, Slate podcasts averaged ~75 views/video last week while NPR averaged ~179/video; studio footage drives views higher  —  Hello and welcome back to Soundbite.  Today we'll look at how podcast networks are faring on YouTube and have an update on Sony Music Entertainment's podcast efforts.

item.title: AIテキストジェネレーターが静かにインターネットの多くをオーサリングしている。AIが生成した書籍やパーソナライズされた記事が増えることは、人間が書いたコンテンツを買うクライアントが減ることを意味する（Will Oremus/Washington Post）
item.description:
Will Oremus / Washington Post:
AI text generators are quietly authoring more of the internet; more AI-generated books and personalized articles mean fewer clients buying human-written content  —  From recipes to product reviews to how-to books, artificial intelligence text generators are quietly authoring more and more of the internet.

item.title: 2012年に開設されたBuzzFeed Newsがウェブサイトを閉鎖しアーカイブ化、現・元スタッフが最後の投稿として思い出を振り返りながら語る（BuzzFeed News）
item.description:
BuzzFeed News:
BuzzFeed News, launched in 2012, shuts down and archives its website; current and former staff share their memories in a recap as the outlet's final post  —  BuzzFeed News has been described as a chaos agent, a pirate ship, a reputable news organization, and, most notably, a “failing pile of garbage” by former president Donald Trump.

item.title: 情報源Vice Mediaは、Fortress Investment GroupとSoros Fund Managementを含む貸し手によって破産から4億ドルで買収される契約が近づいている（Wall Street Journal）。
item.description:
Wall Street Journal:
Sources: Vice Media is nearing a deal to get acquired out of bankruptcy by lenders including Fortress Investment Group and Soros Fund Management for ~$400M  —  The media business is in talks to sell itself to top lenders Fortress Investment and Soros Fund Management through a reorganization that would wipe out other investors

item.title: CBSが所有するCWの8局は、2023年9月に独立し、パラマウントのコンテンツを扱い、ScrippsやGray TVのようなスポーツ契約を目指す予定（Alex Weprin/The Hollywood Reporter）。
item.description:
Alex Weprin / The Hollywood Reporter:
Eight CW stations owned by CBS plan to go independent in September 2023, carry Paramount content, and pursue sports deals akin to Scripps' and Gray TV's  —  CW stations in Philadelphia, Seattle, Atlanta, Detroit and other major markets will drop their affiliation and go independent.

item.title: Scrippsは、WNBAの試合を放送する契約を結んだ2週間後に、RSNをバイパスするもう一つのチームであるNHLのVegas Golden Knightsの試合を放送する複数年契約を締結しました（John Ourand/Sports Business Journal）。
item.description:
John Ourand / Sports Business Journal:
Scripps signs a multiyear deal to carry the games of the NHL's Vegas Golden Knights, another team bypassing RSNs, two weeks after signing to carry WNBA games  —  For the second time in a week, a local broadcast channel picked up the rights to a professional sports team.
